annotation.assayComponentEndpointDesc: Data from the assay component ACEA_ER_80hr was analyzed into 2 assay endpoints. This assay endpoint, ACEA_ER_80hr_Positive, was analyzed in the positive fitting direction relative to DMSO as the negative control and baseline of activity. Using a type of growth reporter, measures of the cells for gain - of -signal activity can be used to understand the signaling at the pathway - level as they relate to the gene ESR1.
annotation.assayComponentDesc: ACEA_ER_80hr, is one of two assay component(s) measured or calculated from the ACEA_ER assay. It is designed to make measurements of real-time cell-growth kinetics, a form of growth reporter, as detected with electrical impedance signals by Real-Time Cell Electrode Sensor (RT-CES) technology.
annotation.assayComponentTargetDesc: Electrical impedance is used to quantify changes to the growth of the cells where increase impedance is positively correlated with increased cell growth
annotation.assayDesc: ACEA_ER is a cell-based, single-readout assay that uses T47D, a human breast cell line, with measurements taken at 80 hours after chemical dosing in a 96-well or 384-well plate.
annotation.assaySourceDesc: ACEA Biosciences, Inc. (ACEA) is a privately owned biotechnology company that developed a real-time, label-free, cell-based assay system based on a microelectronic readout called xCELLigence.

tcplProcessing.description: plate-wise median response of positive control (max)

aops.aopTitle: Estrogen receptor activation leading to breast cancer
